oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Colorized postcard of World War I soldiers pitching tents for camp
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: This colorized postcard shows a World War I military unit pitching their tents to set up camp. The postcard is adressed to Mrs. L. O. Redford, mother of Musician Kenneth G. Redford, 114th FA, HQ Co., 30th Div. Redford writes his mother to let her know he is well and will write a letter soon. There is a 3 cent postage stamp on the postcard.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: World War, 1914-1918; World War, 1914-1918 - History
